Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence

Source: R/modelling-rho-calibration.R
calibrate_rho_case_balance.Rd

Calibrate the reporting fraction rho in the susceptible balance recurrence used by estimate_susceptible_case_balance() so that the model matches a target susceptible count at a chosen time.

Usage

calibrate_rho_case_balance(
  panel,
  iso3,
  years,
  target_year,
  target_susceptible_n,
  births_col = "births",
  coverage_col = "coverage",
  cases_col = "cases",
  s0 = NULL,
  ve = 1,
  rho_interval = c(1e-04, 1)
)

Arguments

panel

Panel data.frame/tibble containing at least iso3/year/births, coverage, and cases columns.

iso3

ISO3 code to filter panel.

years

Vector of years (integers) to use for the recurrence. Must be covered by panel for iso3.

target_year

Year at which to match target_susceptible_n.

target_susceptible_n

Target susceptible count at target_year.

births_col

Births column.

coverage_col

Coverage column.

cases_col

Cases column.

s0

Initial susceptible count at first year; defaults to births in the first year.

ve

Vaccine effectiveness multiplier applied to coverage when computing vaccinated births.

rho_interval

Search interval for rho.

Value

A scalar numeric rho.

Details

This helper does not require {odin2}.

Examples

panel <- data.frame(
  iso3 = rep("AAA", 4),
  year = 2000:2003,
  births = 0,
  coverage = 0,
  cases = 10
)

# With s0=100, cases=10, rho=0.5 implies depletion per step = 10/0.5=20:
# S: 100, 80, 60, 40
calibrate_rho_case_balance(
  panel,
  iso3 = "AAA",
  years = 2000:2003,
  target_year = 2003,
  target_susceptible_n = 40,
  s0 = 100,
  rho_interval = c(0.1, 1)
)
#> [1] 0.4999928
